unnormalised: Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Crucial for Festive Season Surge
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Crucial for Festive Season Surge

unnormalised: As Diwali approaches, Indian manufacturers are ramping up production, making robust quality control paramount. Experts at IIT Madras emphasize that a single faulty component can cascade into widespread product recalls, impacting brand reputation and profitability, especially during peak sales.
normalised: As Diwali approaches, Indian manufacturers are ramping up production, making robust quality control paramount. Experts at I I T Madras emphasize that a single faulty component can cascade into widespread product recalls, impacting brand reputation and profitability, especially during peak sales.

unnormalised: Recent studies indicate a 15% increase in customer complaints related to product defects around major festivals like Onam. To combat this, companies like Tata Steel are implementing stricter quality checks, from raw material sourcing (e.g., iron ore from Odisha) to final product assembly.
normalised: Recent studies indicate a fifteen percent increase in customer complaints related to product defects around major festivals like Onam. To combat this, companies like Tata Steel are implementing stricter quality checks, from raw material sourcing (for example, iron ore from Odisha) to final product assembly.

unnormalised: "Think of quality control like the perfect blend of spices in Hyderabadi biryani," explains Mr. Sharma, a seasoned quality control manager. "If even one ingredient is off, the entire dish suffers."
normalised: "Think of quality control like the perfect blend of spices in Hyderabadi biryani," explains Mister Sharma, a seasoned quality control manager. "If even one ingredient is off, the entire dish suffers."

unnormalised: Investing in advanced testing equipment and training programs for workers in places like Gurgaon is crucial. Failure to do so could lead to significant losses, estimated at Rs. 5 crores for some companies during the last festive season due to returned goods. The Ministry of Commerce is urging SMEs to adopt ISO 9001 standards to ensure consistent quality across the supply chain, preventing defective products from reaching consumers in even remote areas, like villages 200 km from Patna.
